column4: whoever sent me a link to how to install tghem I guess didn't know that
pr was intentionally wasting my time.  :)
but I still can't detect my displays
So any thoughts on getting this thing to use both monitors in a useful fashion?
I hate the thought of reinstalling the OS That Shall NOt Be Named
and can't get both monitors to do anything other than mirror each other through my ATI card
want both as part of one desktop
Not gonna run a beta, sorry.
And am hoping to leave MS forever.
So I really just want to get this working under intrepid.  I didn't come to an ubuntu channel to have someone try to talk me into Windows
there are supposedly settings in your screen resolution gui
is there not an advance tab there
I am ignorant of your answer but have you tried to google dual monitors in ubuntu ?
let me see what I can find
that yields a bunch of stuff
the only other distro I know of that is a plug n play as ubuntu is mandriva .... possibly suse.... fedora is more bleeding edge but less stable
you will have to get used to the nvidia bias that permeates all linux
